subject: AccuWeather.com Alert(tm) Advisory  (avcavc)
body:
AccuWeather.com Alert[TM]






















 







							Severe Watches and Warnings for BEVERLY HILLS 













LOXCFWLOX
WHUS46 KLOX 131252
CFWLOX

COASTAL HAZARD MESSAGE
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LOS ANGELES/OXNARD CA
552 AM PDT FRI APR 13 2007

..HIGH SURF CONTINUES ON SOUTHWEST FACING BEACHES OF SOUTHERN
CALIFORNIA...

A SOMEWHAT LARGE WESTERLY SWELL GENERATED BY STRONG NORTHWEST
FLOW CONTINUES OVER THE COASTAL WATERS. IN ADDITION...THE MODERATE
SOUTHERLY SWELL FROM A PREVIOUS STORM IN THE SOUTHERN HEMISPHERE
CONTINUES TO IMPACT THE AREA. THIS COMBINATION OF WESTERLY AND
SOUTHERLY SWELLS WILL PRODUCE HIGH SURF ALONG THE EXPOSED SOUTHWEST
FACING BEACHES OF SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA AS WELL AS HIGH RIP CURRENT
RISK THROUGH TONIGHT.

CAZ040-041-131900-
/O.CON.KLOX.SU.Y.0006.000000T0000Z-070414T0500Z/
VENTURA COUNTY COAST-
LOS ANGELES COUNTY COAST INCLUDING DOWNTOWN LOS ANGELES-
552 AM PDT FRI APR 13 2007

..HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PDT THIS
EVENING...

A HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PDT THIS EVENING.

FIVE TO SEVEN FOOT BREAKERS ARE EXPECTED TO CONTINUE AT THE BEACHES
OF LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTY...ESPECIALLY AT FAVORABLY EXPOSED
SOUTHWEST FACING BEACHES THROUGH TONIGHT. MAXIMUM SETS UP TO EIGHT
FEET ARE POSSIBLE AT THE MOST EXPOSED LOCATIONS THIS AFTERNOON. WHILE
THE GUSTY WINDS DRIVING THIS SWELL HAVE BEGUN TO DIMINISH...CONDITIONS
ARE STILL EXPECTED TO BE HAZARDOUS THROUGH THE EVENING. THE COMBINATION
OF HIGH SURF WITH THE MIXED NORTHWEST AND SOUTH SWELL WILL ALSO CONTINUE
TO PRODUCE DANGEROUS RIP CURRENTS ALONG THE BEACHES OF LOS ANGELES AND
VENTURA COUNTIES. SURF WILL SUBSIDE BY THIS EVENING.

$$

CAZ034-035-131900-
/O.CON.KLOX.CF.S.0004.000000T0000Z-070414T0500Z/
SAN LUIS OBISPO COUNTY CENTRAL COAST-
SANTA BARBARA COUNTY CENTRAL COAST-
552 AM PDT FRI APR 13 2007

..ABOVE NORMAL SURF EXPECTED ALONG THE CENTRAL COAST...

SEVEN TO NINE FOOT BREAKERS ARE EXPECTED ALONG THE CENTRAL CALIFORNIA
COAST TODAY...WITH LOCAL SETS TO TEN FEET ALONG FAVORABLY EXPOSED
WEST FACING BEACHES. WHILE THE PERIOD OF THESE WAVES IS ONLY NEAR
TWELVE SECONDS...A STRONG NORTHWEST SWELL DRIVEN BY NORTHWEST WINDS
IS STILL EXPECTED TO IMPACT THE COASTLINE THROUGH THE AFTERNOON.
SURF SHOULD SUBSIDE THIS EVENING.

$$

MEIER
